content: Hey all! Meeting in 20. We'll be discussing release retro today primarily, but I also want to spend a bit of time looking at release blog post for next cycle (i.e., who will own it)
@T-release meeting!
alright, @DPC let's do a triage check in to start
going through the prs, closed some, looking into the others
i havent looked closely into the reasons behind the open prs though, guess i might have something for next week
hm I think @XAMPPRocky is working on collecting some stats potentially, so maybe good to sync up there
cool
alright
I haven't started on that yet, I plan to start next week, so we can discuss it.
let's move on to release retro
first off I think blog post went really well
@cuviper would you say things felt good throughout the process? anything you noticed that felt unfortunate? (or others, just asking since you're author :)
People seemed to react really well to the niche explanation.
Of course, now some people want to write their own niches. :smile:
Yeah, I think it went well. It helped to have a lot of time to work on feedback.
I wasn't sure how much to explain about stuff like the niche, so I'm glad that was well received
ok - do you feel like you could commit to doing it again this time around?
(on a similarish timeline)
Maybe, if no one else is interested.
I kind of intended that we would be spreading this responsibility around more. Maybe even get Steve back on it sometimes.
:smile:
I wouldn't doing it, I would have the time, but I also wouldn't mind not doing it. :smile:
Heh
1.51 is bigger for const generics
Ok, let's maybe try @XAMPPRocky doing it this time, but we can also sync up in a week or two on the details
alright, I did want to note a pain point
we don't have master promoted and the beta came out later than usual, primarily because of unknown to (at least) me tool breakage I think
this tells me that toolstate is probably not being checked or tracked well enough before release week
I did also see one person complain that it wasn't available in Docker at the time of release, but I'm not sure what we can do about that.
That's supposed to be a "no breakage" week, right? Is there any tooling for that?
there is, but we only don't permit new breakage
and I think on aarch64 msvc rls has just been broken for 2 months or something now
(or tests don't pass anyway)

XAMPPRocky said:

I did also see one person complain that it wasn't available in Docker at the time of release, but I'm not sure what we can do about that.

this expectation seems a little unrealistic to me - do they really need the new docker image within 24 hours of the release?
I think they have some fundamental tokio issue in rls, needing a big upgrade
we don't maintain those docker images to my knowledge so it's not on us
so I'm planning to add an action item on the monday of the week before release to check toolstate across the board, so we at least know

simulacrum said:

we don't maintain those docker images to my knowledge so it's not on us

Yeah, that's what I was wondering.
Who does?
I think sfackler? Not sure.

Joshua Nelson said:

XAMPPRocky said:

I did also see one person complain that it wasn't available in Docker at the time of release, but I'm not sure what we can do about that.

this expectation seems a little unrealistic to me - do they really need the new docker image within 24 hours of the release?

If it was controlled by us, I think it's a somewhat reasonable expectation, but it's not so.
oh hm maybe they are semi-official https://github.com/rust-lang/docker-rust
But yes, almost solely sfackler
they are "official", but not part of the release flow
I can note down speaking to sfackler to figure out what the update process is, maybe we can include it in release process or figure out a way to synchronize
I'd personally rather not include in release process
ok great, that's all I had I think, let's @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
ok
that's all from me for the meeting as well, so @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
okay - thanks all! o/
